title: Vafaei first Iranian to win snooker ranking title
description: Hossein Vafaei becomes the first Iranian player to win a snooker ranking title, beating Mark Williams in the final of the Snooker Shoot Out.

title: Viking torch parade marks Celtic Connections in Glasgow
description: The march celebrates the history of Shetland, which is featured at this year’s hybrid music festival.

title: Inflation: Four things that are going up in price and why
description: From skincare products to used cars - the items that tell the story of the cost of living crisis.

title: Ski Sunday: Meet Markus Eder - Possibly the greatest skier you've never heard of
description: British Olympian James Woods introduces possibly the greatest skier you've never heard of - the incredible, Markus Eder.

title: Nusrat Ghani: Muslimness a reason for my sacking, says ex-minister
description: Nusrat Ghani says she was told her faith made colleagues uncomfortable - but the chief whip rejects her claim.

title: Russia-Ukraine tensions: UK warns of plot to install pro-Moscow ally
description: The Foreign Office takes the unusual step of naming a former Ukrainian MP as a potential Kremlin candidate.

title: Stretford stabbing: Four murder arrests after boy, 16, dies
description: The teenager was found with stab wounds and died shortly after being taken to hospital, police say.

title: Covid: Wales could recruit non-jabbed NHS England staff
description: Covid vaccines are not compulsory for NHS staff in Wales but are being mandated in England.

title: Nadal to face Shapovalov in Australian Open quarters
description: Rafael Nadal continues his quest for a record-breaking 21st major title at the Australian Open as Denis Shapovalov beats third seed Alexander Zverev.

title: Covid in Scotland: Restrictions impact 'worth it', says Sturgeon
description: The First Minister says Covid rules made enough of a difference to justify the financial impact on business and hospitality.

title: Welsh ports had 30% less traffic due to Brexit - shipping chief
description: Stena's UK's boss says Brexit not Covid caused the losses, but his company remains committed.

title: Wolves fire: Blaze causes 'significant damage' to Molineux
description: The blaze broke out in the early hours in a bar area and spread to parts of a stand.

title: Royal Family photos found in 'emotional' collection
description: Relatives of an amateur photographer stumble on his "stunning" archive of images of the royals.

title: Barty continues Australian Open quest as Azarenka & Sakkari lose
description: Australian top seed Ashleigh Barty continues her quest to become the first home champion in 44 years, but Victoria Azarenka and fifth seed Maria Sakkari go out.

title: The aurora hunters who chase the Northern Lights
description: Meet the aurora hunters, people fascinated by the spectacular natural phenomenon.

title: Mystery book sculptures to be auctioned in Edinburgh
description: Five creations by an anonymous artist are to be sold to raise funds for the Scottish Book Trust.

title: IS prison break in Syria sparks days of clashes
description: More than 100 people have been killed in the fighting between militants and Kurdish-led forces.

title: The controversial Irish force sent to police Palestine
description: The disbandment of the Royal Irish Constabulary in 1922 led hundreds of ex-members to go overseas.

title: Anoosheh Ashoori: Iranian-Briton starts hunger strike in prison
description: Anoosheh Ashoori from London hopes the strike will bring attention to those being held in Iran.

title: Covid: Call to delay mandatory jabs for NHS staff and Scotland to lift rules
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.

title: The Papers: Partygate probe and Whitehall return to office row
description: The papers report on the inquiry into alleged parties at Downing Street and an MP's claim she lost a ministerial post due to her "Muslimness".

title: England-Australia third Women's Ashes T20 washed out
description: England's third and final Twenty20 against Australia in the Women's Ashes is abandoned without a ball being bowled because of rain in Adelaide.

title: Covid: New Zealand PM Ardern cancels wedding amid Omicron wave
description: New restrictions are set to be introduced after nine Omicron cases were confirmed in the country.

title: Sudan protesters: Ready to die for freedom
description: Those opposed to the coup say they will stay on the streets until the generals leave power.

title: More and more musicians are releasing their own music: Here's why
description: Musicians retaining ownership of their master recordings can get 100% of streaming royalties.

title: Why are old post boxes suddenly going missing?
description: It is thought stolen letterboxes are being sold to unscrupulous collectors, possibly around the world.

title: NDAs misused in casting - actors and agents warn
description: Big US streamers are becoming too sensitive about the secrecy of their projects, industry figures say.

title: Finding love as a trans woman
description: Trans woman Daniella McDonald had bad experiences dating men until she met Josh - but thinks attitudes are slowly changing.

title: Shirley Chisholm: The first black woman to run for US president
description: After becoming the first black woman elected to Congress, Shirley Chisholm declared her intention to run for the US presidency in 1972.

title: Trees: 'Our 5,000-year-old yew should be revered - not ignored'
description: The UK has one of the world's largest collection of ancient yews and campaigners want extra protections.

title: Fundraiser, 83, buys then delivers ambulances across Europe
description: John Shackleton, who has been fundraising for more than 30 years, says his age won't stop him.

title: Overweight armadillos put on a post-Christmas diet
description: Sussex-based armadillos Patsy and Eddie have to shift some pounds after their festive feasting.
